<p>New posters herald Steven Spielberg’s mysterious UFO movie. <em>Crystal Lake</em> showrunner Brad Caleb Kane teases its violence. Plus, <em>Rings of Power</em> wraps filming for season 3. Spoilers now!</p>
<figure><img alt="Io9 2025 Spoiler" sizes="(max-width: 639px) 100vw, (max-width: 1023px) calc(100vw - 2rem), (max-width: 1258px) calc((100vw - 3.68rem) * 2 / 3), 800px" src="https://gizmodo.com/app/uploads/2025/09/io9-2025-spoiler.png" srcset="https://gizmodo.com/app/uploads/2025/09/io9-2025-spoiler.png 2625w, https://gizmodo.com/app/uploads/2025/09/io9-2025-spoiler-336x66.png 336w, https://gizmodo.com/app/uploads/2025/09/io9-2025-spoiler-1280x251.png 1280w, https://gizmodo.com/app/uploads/2025/09/io9-2025-spoiler-768x150.png 768w, https://gizmodo.com/app/uploads/2025/09/io9-2025-spoiler-672x132.png 672w, https://gizmodo.com/app/uploads/2025/09/io9-2025-spoiler-960x188.png 960w, https://gizmodo.com/app/uploads/2025/09/io9-2025-spoiler-1600x313.png 1600w"/><figcaption>Io9 2025 Spoiler</figcaption></figure>
<h2>The Hunger Games: Sunrise on the Reaping</h2>
<p><a href="https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/hunger-games-jennifer-lawrence-josh-hutcherson-sunrise-1236447411/">THR</a> reports that Jennifer Lawrence and Josh Hutcherson will reprise their roles as Katniss Everdeen and Peeta Mellark in the upcoming adaptation of <em>Sunrise on the Reaping</em>. It’s currently unknown just how the characters will appear, presumably as kind of flash forward or framing device given that the film is set around 24 years before the events of the original <em>Hunger Games</em>.</p>
<h2>Steven Spielberg UFO Movie</h2>
<p>Billboards for Steven Spielberg’s UFO movie, rumored to be titled <em>Disclosure</em>, have appeared in Los Angeles and New York. Head over to <a href="https://www.worldofreel.com/blog/2025/12/10/spielberg-poster-teases-mysterious-new-ufo-movie">World of Reel</a> for a look.</p>
<h2>Good Luck, Have Fun, Don’t Die</h2>
<p><a href="https://bloody-disgusting.com/movie/3921121/gore-verbinskis-sci-fi-movie-good-luck-have-fun-dont-die-gets-r-rating/">Bloody-Disgusting</a> reports Gore Verbinski’s <em>Good Luck, Have Fun, Don’t Die</em> has been rated R for “pervasive language, violence, some grisly images, and brief sexual content.”</p>
<h2>Supergirl</h2>
<p>Warner Bros. has released a brief glimpse of the <em>Supergirl</em> trailer, ahead of its release later today.</p>
<figure><p class="rw-outer-content"><span>Some content could not be imported from the original document.</span> <a href="https://platform.twitter.com/embed/Tweet.html?creatorScreenName=Gizmodo&amp;dnt=true&amp;embedId=twitter-widget-0&amp;%3D%3D&amp;frame=false&amp;hideCard=false&amp;hideThread=false&amp;id=1998815498700775736&amp;lang=en&amp;origin=https%3A%2F%2Fgizmodo.com%2Fhunger-games-sunrise-on-the-reaping-jennifer-lawrence-josh-hutcherson-2000698322&amp;sessionId=2b1b9a8ee713796c9ceea948f70778f146f34081&amp;siteScreenName=Gizmodo&amp;theme=light&amp;widgetsVersion=2615f7e52b7e0%3A1702314776716&amp;width=500px">View content ↗ </a></p></figure>

<h2>Invoking Scream</h2>
<p>We also have a trailer for <em>Invoking Scream</em>, the sequel to <em>Invoking Yell,</em> in which a heavy metal band accidentally unleashes demonic forces with a VHS tape and a book of witchcraft.</p>
<figure><img alt="" src="https://i.ytimg.com/vi/bkzVPUNbzSk/hqdefault.jpg"/></figure>
<figure><img src="https://gizmodo.com/app/plugins/wp-rocket/assets/img/youtube.png"/></figure>
<figure><div class="rw-embed-wrapper"><embed src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/bkzVPUNbzSk?feature=oembed" type="video/mp4"/></div></figure>
<h2>Crystal Lake</h2>
<p>During a recent interview with Entertainment Weekly, showrunner Brad Caleb Kane described <em>Crystal Lake</em> as a “paranoid 70’s thriller” with “rivers of blood.”</p>
<blockquote><p>In many ways, it’s a psychological thriller. It’s a paranoid ’70s thriller. It has all of the DNA of a slasher without quite being a slasher. There are rivers of blood in the show. There are very, I think, ingenious kill sequences and deaths and murders, but it’s all done in service of character and theme and place and time.</p> <p>I tried to think about Crystal Lake and a <em>Friday the 13th</em> prequel as, ‘What era did the first movie come out of?’ It came out of the paranoid ’70s thriller era. It came out of the mistrust-of-institutions era. It came out of the women’s lib era, the National Organization for Women era, this consciousness-raising awakening era in America. I wanted to go and play with all of those themes.</p></blockquote>
<p>Kane <a href="https://ew.com/crystal-lake-preview-friday-the-13th-prequel-rivers-of-blood-exclusive-11865503">also stated</a> Linda Cardellini will “shock and surprise a lot of people” with her performance as Pamela Voorhees.</p>
<blockquote><p>I think [Linda Cardellini’s] gonna get a lot of attention for this role. She’s inconceivably brilliant in it. I can’t really say any more.</p></blockquote>
<h2>The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power</h2>
<p>Filming has wrapped on the third season of <em>The Rings of Power</em>.</p>
<figure><p class="rw-outer-content"><span>Some content could not be imported from the original document.</span> <a href="https://platform.twitter.com/embed/Tweet.html?creatorScreenName=Gizmodo&amp;dnt=true&amp;embedId=twitter-widget-1&amp;%3D%3D&amp;frame=false&amp;hideCard=false&amp;hideThread=false&amp;id=1998799916907246024&amp;lang=en&amp;origin=https%3A%2F%2Fgizmodo.com%2Fhunger-games-sunrise-on-the-reaping-jennifer-lawrence-josh-hutcherson-2000698322&amp;sessionId=2b1b9a8ee713796c9ceea948f70778f146f34081&amp;siteScreenName=Gizmodo&amp;theme=light&amp;widgetsVersion=2615f7e52b7e0%3A1702314776716&amp;width=500px">View content ↗ </a></p></figure>
<h2>Very Young Frankenstein</h2>
<p>Finally, Kumail Nanjiani described the <em>Very Young Frankenstein</em> pilot as “a really fun shoot” in a recent interview with <a href="https://x.com/DEADLINE/status/1998456256005104020">Deadline</a>.</p>
